meanings.sent1: She effaces all the mistakes on her paper with a big eraser.
meanings.sent2: The heavy rain effaces the chalk drawings on the sidewalk.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous puppy effaces the evidence of his mischief by burying the torn pillow.
meanings.sent4: Time effaces the memories of pain, leaving only faint traces behind.
meanings.sent5: The strong wind effaces footprints in the sand, leaving a blank canvas for new ones.

meanings.definition: To make oneself appear insignificant or inconspicuous
meanings.sent1: He effaces himself in group photos by standing at the back.
meanings.sent2: The shy student effaces her presence in class discussions.
meanings.sent3: The chameleon effaces its bright colors to blend into the green leaves.
meanings.sent4: In the bustling city, she effaces her identity by wearing a plain mask.
meanings.sent5: The ninja effaces into the shadows, becoming one with the darkness.
